entry.title: Sunset,
entry.content:
Sunset

The sunset is beautiful — 
its redness deep, its intensity full.
Every time I witness such beauty,
I can’t look away.
Tears begin to fall.
Not quite crying — 
just something soft breaking open inside me.
I feel a sadness,
not from what is there,
but from what I’ve forgotten.
So many moments lost,
too few glances at nature
held long enough to remember.
Maybe this is how life was meant to be — 
Nature, or something more,
perhaps a hymn,
or just human emotion,
nudging me gently:
“Look again, feel deeper.”
And yet, something resists.
A strange stillness in me
tries to stop these words
from flowing free.
But I write anyway, through fading light — 
for even sunsets deserve to be written right.

entry.title: Found love
entry.content:
Found love again

Falling in love again,
With the simplicity in her eyes,
The calmness in her nature,
The way she sits near,
The way she walks beside me.

I fell in love again — 
Her beautiful smile,
Her childish giggle,
Her dress,
The way she captures every moment,
Even in the rush of life.

I cannot contain this feeling,
Writing it down, letting the world know:
There’s always a plan,
Nature weaves its threads.
Let’s see if the thread from her finger
Is tied to mine.
I trust nature — 
If she’s meant to be with me, she will be.

I shout to the world:
I’ve discovered the feeling of love.
Watching the sunset from the train,
Her face glowing in the last rays,
Her eyes protected from the light.

I’ve found love and innocence,
In every aspect of life.

entry.title: Pen
entry.content:
Peace! Silence! Quietness!
I’m not sure if these states exist.
Are they real, or just illusions?
Maybe I need a better pen.

Writing slowly, patiently,
Listening to the voice in my head,
Remembering how to write beautifully.

If I believe in you,
Then you must have written my life in haste — 
A question scribbled without care,
Or without caring to ask the question at all.

Why do I curse my life in hard times?
This, too, shall pass,
Just like moments of bliss once did.

I expect nothing, yet I write,
As beautifully as I can — 
Not just to leave the impression
That I had time to write,
But to prove
That something beautiful can still be written.

entry.title: Unfinished Promises
entry.content:
I always cared for only me,
Never thought of what you’d be.
How did you manage to move on?
Like the river that keeps flowing, gone.

How much pain did you endure?
Like a storm that’s fierce, yet pure.
I promised I’d always be near,
But now I’m lost, like leaves, unclear.

Forgot the way that leads me home,
Like the wind, I drift alone.
One thing I’ll always fear,
Is your happiness, my dear.

Your smile, the sun that lights my way,
No matter what, I’ll always stay.
Through everything, like trees that sway,
I could never hate you, come what may.

entry.title: Water in a Borrowed Shape
entry.content:
I don’t belong anywhere,
I am everywhere — 
But I am never there
Where I need to be.

I am like water in a bottle,
Trapped in a shape that isn’t mine.
Content within someone’s artistic concept — 
But am I even needed in this world?
I surely belong to the sea — 
That’s where I feel my power.

I am the path of light,
Seen, explored — but never chosen.
I am the music of light,
Played but never understood.
Harmonious, yet without a home.

entry.title: Even in Heaven
entry.content:
Every day, the same chase — 
And the chase never ends.
Chasing the rising sun,
Cursing the morning burn.

Chasing the blue moon,
Cursing the afternoon.
Chasing and cursing — 
Without these, life is not lived.

What waits in heaven?
Does the chasing end?
Does the cursing stop?

Yes! someone shouted from the back — 
A drowning sun, with a cold sensation.
A fading moon, with a light burn.
This is heaven, my friend.

entry.title: This Pebble
entry.content:
This pebble thought of dying without her.
He lives and breathes — just breathing.
I used to wonder, at what cost?
The cost of dreams they built from dust.
Dreams that never became real — 
And never will.

A moment of bright light,
In her eyes he’ll never see again.
He just breathes with these fragments,
Never turning, never moved,
A weight of love, a life removed.

Until someone picks me from the road,
Carries me back to my old abode,
And sets me near the vase to stay — 
A ghost too small to drift away.

entry.title: Sickness
entry.content:
I ask questions — too many questions.
One always remains unanswered — 
What is this sickness?

Questioning my sickness
Becomes the sickness itself.
This light is a sickness.
This life is a sickness.
I don’t know what sickness is — 
Only that life is meant to be lived in it.

Understand it, and you’ll get sick.
Deny it, and sickness will find you on your deathbed.
Ignore it, and maybe you’ll never have it — 
But maybe you never really lived.

entry.title: A Quiet Weight
entry.content:
In the stillness of the dark,
Where the world quietly slips away,
You are left with your thoughts — 
Heavy, untold.
A heart full of desires,
And wounds that never seem to heal.

You walk a road unseen,
Longing for warmth that never stays,
For love that slipped through your grasp,
Regret carved into every step.

Walls rise from your pain,
Yet, still, in silence, you hope — 
Hope for touch, for care,
For something that might ease this weight,
Even if just for a while.

But the quiet grows deafening,
Tears fall without a sound.
You are both broken and strong — 
Trapped between a past
That won’t release its grip,
And a future
That feels too far to believe in.

And still, you breathe.
And that, for now, is enough.

entry.title: No Savior Needed
entry.content:
Silence of the grass field,
Thick air that grips, won’t let me yield.
Dust in the sky makes me blind,
I close my eyes, hold my breath, unwind.
Your face appears — then I push it away,
No savior needed in this void I’ve made.

The darkness wraps me, cold and tight,
I’ll carve my path alone through the night.
The snow falls heavy, a frozen grave,
Biting winds howl, but I stay brave.
Each step sinks deep, the cold cuts through,
This desolate world needs no help from you.

The rain pours down, a deafening roar,
Drenched to the bone, I seek no more.
Each drop whispers I’m still alive,
Through storm and shadow, alone I’ll thrive.
